alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 21 at 5:07PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Virginia, including Franklin County. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 506 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring near Rocky Mount. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rocky Mount, Boones Mill, Ferrum, Wirtz, Callaway, Burnt Chimney and Sontag. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
